data.text: @davewiner according to @Bob_Wachter and yesterday's Grand Rounds, my understanding is 'yes', less likely to be severe or deadly. I am NOT an MD, nor do I 'play one on TV'
@davewiner Congrats! I got my first dose on 2/5

@davewiner It keeps you from getting sick, it doesn’t keep you from getting infected or transmitting. Those things are likely reduced but not well studied yet. So have fun but don’t throw away your mask just yet 🖖🏼

@davewiner A clarification, because this confused me as well: immunity is effectively binary. 95% efficacy means there's a 1 in 20 chance your body won't generate the necessary immune response after vaccination, but if it does, you're totally protected.
@davewiner Yes, according to the moderna materials.
@faketonyg thank you, it's like graduation day in a way. ;-)
@davewiner At least there's one good thing about getting older: getting the vaccine. (Also Medicare.)
@davewiner Yes, your chances of severe disease go way down. Death very very unlikely. Not sure how long vaccine lasts though.
@davewiner My son got his second dose on Wednesday. Slept quite a bit yesterday, is at work today. Mom gets second shot tomorrow.
8/8 And yes this is yet another boomer privilege. It's fair to hate me but only for this. :-)
7/8 It's been 1.5 years since I've been to a city larger than Kingston, NY. I'm actually quite happy about that. I like life in the mountains.
6/8 What should I risk after immunity? Go to the movies? Drive down to the city, just to get some bagels perhaps or ride a CitiBike in Central Park? These would seem very exotic now.
5/8 Of course I'm going to continue to be masked. I ordered some new Docker brand masks for the event.
4/8 A bit of info I don't have -- if I were to get infected would it be less likely to be severe or deadly?

3/8 A couple of weeks later, say by March 3, according to the science, I will be at 95% immunity. This means the probability of me getting infected, everything else constant, is only 5% of what it was before January 20.
2/8 I had mild side-effects with the first shot, which I got on January 20, also Inauguration Day. I expect it to be worse this time, but I'm excited and a little disoriented by the new reality.
